list.name: 기역
list.sentence: ㄱ “giyeok” g/k [k/] makes the same sound as the g in good. 가방 is pronounced kabang which means bag.

list.name: 니은
list.sentence: ㄴ “nien” n [n] makes the same sound as the n in nose. 노래 is pronounced norae which means song.

list.name: 디귿
list.sentence: ㄷ “diget” d/t [t/d] makes the same sound as the d in day. 대한민국 is pronounced dae han min guk which means South Korea.

list.name: 리을
list.sentence: ㄹ “riel” l/r [l/r] makes the same sound as the l in lamp. 라면 is pronounced ramyeon which means ramen.

list.name: 미음
list.sentence: ㅁ “miem” m [m] makes the same sound as the m in moon. 엄마 is pronounced eomma which means mum.

list.name: 비읍
list.sentence: ㅂ “biep p/b [p/b] makes the same sound as the b in banana. 밥 is pronounced bap which means rice.

list.name: 시옷
list.sentence: ㅅ “shiot” s [s] makes the same sound as the s in spoon. 사과 is pronounced sa gwa which means apple.

list.name: 이응
list.sentence: ㅇ “ieng” silent/ng [ŋ] silent sound or ng sound like in yang. 방 is pronounced bang which means room.

list.name: 지읒
list.sentence: ㅈ “jiet” j [ts] makes the same sound as the j in jelly. 지도 is pronounced jido which means map.

list.name: 치읓
list.sentence: ㅊ “chiet” ch [sʰ] makes the same sound as the ch in chair. 친구 is pronounced as chingu which means friend.

list.name: 키읔
list.sentence: ㅋ “kiuek” k [kʰ] makes the same sound as the k in kiwi. 커피 is pronounced as kopi which means coffee.

list.name: 티읕
list.sentence: ㅌ “tiet” t [tʰ] makes the same sound as the t in table. 토마토 is pronounced tomato which is the same word in English, tomato! This one is easy!

list.name: 피읖
list.sentence: ㅍ “piep” p [pʰ] makes the same sound as the p in panda. 팔 is pronounced pal which means arm.

list.name: 히잏
list.sentence: “hiet” h [h] makes the same sound as the h in hat. 하늘 is pronounced haneul which means sky.

list.name: 아
list.sentence: ㅏ a [a] makes the same sound as the a at the end of santa. 차 is pronounced cha which means car.

list.name: 어
list.sentence: ㅓ eo [ʌ] makes the same sound as o in song without the ng sound. 버스 is pronounced bosseu which means bus.

list.name: 오
list.sentence: ㅗ o [o] makes the same sound as the o in doll. 봄 is pronounced bom which means spring.

list.name: 우
list.sentence: ㅜ u [u] makes the same sound as the u in unicorn. 문 is pronounced mun which means door.

list.name: 으
list.sentence: ㅡ eu [ɨ] This sound does not exist in English. The best comparison of this sound is when you are confused with something… “uh?”.

list.name: 이
list.sentence: ㅣ i [i] makes the same sound as the y in baby. 아이 is pronounced a e which means child.

list.name: 쌍기역
list.sentence: ㄲ “ssang giyeok” kk [k*] makes the same sound as the k in ski. 꿀 is pronounced kkul which means honey.

list.name: 쌍디귿
list.sentence: ㄸ “ssang diget” tt [t*] makes the same sound as the t in kitten. 딸 is pronounced ddal which means daughter.

list.name: 쌍비읍
list.sentence: ㅃ “ssang biep” p [p*] makes the same sound as the p in apartment. 아빠 is pronounced appa which means dad.

list.name: 쌍시옷
list.sentence: ㅆ “ssang shiot” ss [s*] makes the same sound as the sh in sushi. 쑥 is pronounced ssuk which means mugwort (a traditional plant in Korea used in medicine and cosmetics).

list.name: 쌍지읒
list.sentence: ㅉ “ssang jiet” [tsʰ] is also a bit tricky because there is no equivalent in the English language.
